name: biomni-count-bacterial-colonies
title: Biomni: Count Bacterial Colonies
description: Count bacterial colonies from an image of agar plate using computer vision techniques
content:
Overview

Performs automated bacterial colony counting from digital images of agar plates using advanced computer vision and image processing techniques. This tool eliminates manual counting errors, provides consistent results, and calculates bacterial concentration (CFU/mL) based on dilution factors and plate area. Particularly useful for high-throughput microbiological analysis and quality control applications.

Input Parameters

  • image_path (required): Path to the digital image of the agar plate (supports JPG, PNG, TIFF formats)
  • dilution_factor (optional, default: 1): The dilution factor applied to the sample before plating
  • plate_area_cm2 (optional, default: 65.0): Area of the agar plate in square centimeters (standard 9 cm diameter plate = 63.6 cm²)
  • output_dir (optional, default: './output'): Directory for saving annotated images and results

Biological Use Case

Essential for microbiology applications including:

  • Quantification of bacterial load in environmental samples
  • Viable cell counting in fermentation processes
  • Antimicrobial susceptibility testing and minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) determination
  • Quality control in food, pharmaceutical, and clinical microbiology
  • Growth curve analysis and bacterial kinetics studies
  • High-throughput screening of bacterial isolates

Output

Generates detailed colony analysis results including:

  • Total colony count on the plate
  • Calculated bacterial concentration (CFU/mL or CFU/g)
  • Annotated image showing detected colonies
  • Colony size distribution statistics
  • Quality metrics and confidence scores
  • Comprehensive summary report (colony_count_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
